Physics Validation Tests ¶ Running the Tests ¶ Tests are run with bash run_physics_validation.slm (or sbatch on HPC); use --particle-pusher , --field-solver , --particle-mesh-coupling , or --all to choose groups. On first run the script creates a local .venv in this directory and installs dependencies from requirements.txt (numpy, openpmd-api); later runs reuse that venv. The HEXAPIC executable needs libopenPMD.so at runtime — the script sets LD_LIBRARY_PATH from OPENPMD_ROOT (default ../openpmd relative to the repo); override with export OPENPMD_ROOT=/path/to/openpmd if your openPMD install is elsewhere. I. Particle Pusher Verification ¶ These tests verify the Boris integrator and 3V vector logic. Maxwell solver and Deposition are disabled ( FieldSolverFlag = 0 ). Threshold framework: All thresholds are adaptive, computed as \[ 	ext{threshold} = K 	imes (	ext{physics\_err} + 	ext{float\_err}) \] where \(K=10\) is a safety factor. Physics error captures Boris integrator \(O(\Delta t^2)\) phase drift, and float error captures \(O(\epsilon_m \sqrt{N})\) accumulation over \(N\) output steps ( \(\epsilon_m \approx 2.22 	imes 10^{-16}\) ). 1) Multi-Species Larmor Orbit (In-Plane) ¶ Description: Verifies basic cyclotron rotation in the simulation plane (x, y) and charge sign handling using an electron–positron pair. Field E: Disabled Field B: \(B=(0,\,0,\,0.1)\) T Particles: Species 1 (e−): \(q=-e,\; m=m_e,\; v_0=(10^6,\; -8794,\; 0)\) m/s Species 2 (e+): \(q=+e,\; m=m_e,\; v_0=(10^6,\; +8794,\; 0)\) m/s (The non-zero \(v_y\) is the Boris half-step back correction: \(v_y \approx \mp v_\perp \omega_c \Delta t / 2\) .) Simulation Time: \(\Delta t = 10^{-12}\) s, \(T_{	ext{total}}= 3 	imes T_{	ext{Larmor}}\) . Only the last 1/3 of output steps is analyzed (initial transient skipped). Metrics & Pass Criteria: Energy Conservation (Absolute): \[ \epsilon_E = \max|E_k(t)-E_k(0)|, \quad E_k = 	frac{1}{2}m(v_x^2+v_y^2+v_z^2) \] Pass if: \(\epsilon_E < K \cdot \epsilon_m \cdot \sqrt{N}\) 4-Radius Separation: \[ \Delta_{	ext{sep}} = \max_t \left|\mathbf{x}_{e^-}(t) - \mathbf{x}_{e^+}(t)ight| \] Expected \(4 R_L\) where \(R_L = \dfrac{m\, v_\perp}{|q|\, B_0}\) . Pass if: \[ |\Delta_{	ext{sep}} - 4 R_L| < K \cdot \!\left(4 R_L \cdot  rac{20(\omega_c \Delta t)^2}{12} + 4 R_L \cdot \epsilon_m \sqrt{N}ight) \] Y-Projection Trajectory: \[ 	ext{Extent} =  igl(\max(y) - \min(y) igr) \cdot \Delta y \] Expected \(2 R_L\) . Pass if: \[ |	ext{extent} - 2 R_L| < K \cdot \!\left(2 R_L \cdot  rac{10(\omega_c \Delta t)^2}{12} + 2 R_L \cdot \epsilon_m \sqrt{N}ight) \] Z-Axis Stability: \[ \Delta z = \max|z(t)-z(0)| \] Pass if: \(\Delta z < K \cdot R_L \cdot \epsilon_m \cdot \sqrt{N}\) 2) Multi-Species Larmor Orbit (Out-of-Plane / 3V) ¶ Description: Verifies the coupling between the spatial grid (x) and the virtual velocity component ( \(v_z\) ) using a \(B_y\) field. Only the electron trajectory is analyzed. Field E: Disabled Field B: \(B=(0,\,0.1,\,0)\) T Particles: Species 1 (e−) & Species 2 (e+): \(v_0=(0,\;0,\;10^6)\) m/s Simulation Time: \(\Delta t = 10^{-12}\) s, \(T_{	ext{total}}= 3 	imes T_{	ext{Larmor}}\) . Only the last 1/3 of output steps is analyzed. Metrics & Pass Criteria: Energy Conservation (Absolute): \[ \epsilon_E = \max|E_k(t)-E_k(0)| \] Pass if: \(\epsilon_E < K \cdot \epsilon_m \cdot \sqrt{N}\) X-Projection Trajectory: \[ 	ext{Extent} =  igl(\max(x) - \min(x) igr) \cdot \Delta x \] Expected \(2 R_L\) . Pass if: \[ |	ext{extent} - 2 R_L| < K \cdot \!\left(2 R_L \cdot  rac{10(\omega_c \Delta t)^2}{12} + 2 R_L \cdot \epsilon_m \sqrt{N}ight) \] Y-Axis Stability: \[ \Delta y = \max|y(t)-y(0)| \] Pass if: \(\Delta y < K \cdot R_L \cdot \epsilon_m \cdot \sqrt{N}\) 3) E×B Drift ¶ Description: Verifies the Lorentz force combination by creating a drift along the Y-axis via crossed E and B fields. Field E: From boundary potentials: \(V=0\) at \(x=0\) , \(V=100\) V at \(x=L_x=0.01\) m. Gives \(E_x = -10^4\) V/m. Field B: \(B=(0,\,0,\,0.1)\) T Particles: Species 1 (e−): \(v_0=(0,\; 10^5,\; 0)\) m/s. Placed at domain center. Simulation Time: \(\Delta t = 10^{-11}\) s, 400 steps, output every 20 steps. Metrics & Pass Criteria: Hamiltonian Conservation: \[ H = 	frac{1}{2}m|\mathbf{v}|^2 + q\phi \] where \(\phi = -E_x \cdot x\) . Pass if: \[ \max|H(t) - H(0)| < K \cdot \!\left(|H_0| \cdot  rac{(\omega_c \Delta t)^2}{8} + |H_0| \cdot \epsilon_m \sqrt{N}ight) \] Drift Velocity (Y): Mean \(v_y\) over the second half of the simulation, expected \(v_{	ext{drift}} = -E_x / B_z\) . Pass if: \[ | ar{v}_y - v_{	ext{drift}}| < K \cdot \!\left(|v_{	ext{drift}}| \cdot  rac{(\omega_c \Delta t)^2}{8} + |v_{	ext{drift}}| \cdot \epsilon_m \sqrt{N}ight) \] II. Field Solver Verification ¶ These tests verify the Poisson solver logic \[ 
abla^2\phi = - rac{ho}{\epsilon_0} \] and boundary condition implementation. The solver uses an iterative method with target relative residual \(	ext{rtol} \sim 10^{-6}\) . Threshold framework: Thresholds combine solver residual error ( \(O(	ext{rtol})\) ), floating point accumulation ( \(O(\epsilon_m \sqrt{N_{	ext{cells}}})\) ), and grid truncation error ( \(O(1/N)\) ), scaled by safety factor \(K=10\) . 4) Mixed Boundaries (Capacitor / Dirichlet-Neumann) ¶ Description: Verifies the transition between fixed potential (electrodes) and open space (dielectric). Simulates a finite parallel-plate capacitor. Domain: \(32 	imes 32\) grid, \(L = 0.001\) m Boundary Conditions: Y-Axis (Electrodes): \(\phi(x, 0) = -10\) V, \(\phi(x, L_y) = +10\) V (Dirichlet) X-Axis (Open): \(\dfrac{\partial \phi}{\partial x} = 0\) at \(x=0,\, x=L_x\) (Neumann / Dielectric) Source: No particles (vacuum solve) Metrics & Pass Criteria: Boundary Value Integrity: \[ \epsilon_{	ext{BC}} = \max\! igl(|\phi_{y=0} - (-10)|,\; |\phi_{y=L_y} - 10| igr) \] Pass if: \(\epsilon_{	ext{BC}} < K \cdot \epsilon_m \cdot V_0\) Field Uniformity (Interior): Standard deviation of \(E_y\) in the interior (excluding 2-cell border near Neumann/Dirichlet corners). Pass if: \[ \sigma(E_y) < K \cdot \!\left(| ar{E}_y| \cdot 	ext{rtol} + | ar{E}_y| \cdot \epsilon_m \sqrt{N_{	ext{cells}}}ight) \] 5) Fully Open Boundaries (Isolated System) ¶ Description: Verifies solver stability for a floating potential system using all-Neumann boundaries. Uses a neutral dipole to ensure \(\int ho \, dV = 0\) . Domain: \(32 	imes 32\) grid, \(L = 0.001\) m Boundary Conditions: All boundaries: \(\dfrac{\partial \phi}{\partial n} = 0\) (Neumann everywhere) Source: Neutral Dipole — electron cloud at \(x \approx 0.35\, L\) , positron cloud at \(x \approx 0.65\, L\) . Metrics & Pass Criteria: Boundary Flux Leakage: Maximum of mean \(|E_n|\) across all four boundaries. Pass if: \[ \max\! igl(\overline{|E_x|}_{	ext{walls}},\; \overline{|E_y|}_{	ext{walls}} igr) < K \cdot \!\left(E_{	ext{scale}} \cdot 	ext{rtol} + E_{	ext{scale}} \cdot \epsilon_m \sqrt{N} +  rac{E_{	ext{scale}}}{N_{\min}}ight) \] where \(E_{	ext{scale}} = \max|\mathbf{E}|\) over the domain, \(N_{\min} = \min(N_x, N_y)\) . 6) Closed Metal Box (All-Dirichlet) ¶ Description: Verifies the basic "grounded box" scenario. Tests solver matrix construction and solution symmetry. Domain: \(32 	imes 32\) grid, \(L = 0.001\) m Boundary Conditions: All boundaries: \(\phi = 0\) (Ground) Source: Electron charge cloud centered at \((L_x/2,\, L_y/2)\) . Metrics & Pass Criteria: Boundary Zero Check: \[ \epsilon_{	ext{wall}} = \max_{	ext{all boundaries}} |\phi| \] Pass if: \(\epsilon_{	ext{wall}} < K \cdot \epsilon_m \cdot \max(|\phi_{	ext{boundary}}|, 1)\) Symmetry: \[ \epsilon_{	ext{sym}} = P_{99.9}\! igl(|\phi(x,y) - \phi(L_x-x,\, L_y-y)| igr) \] over interior points (excluding 2-cell border and 3-cell radius around center singularity). Pass if: \[ \epsilon_{	ext{sym}} < K \cdot \!\left(V_{	ext{scale}} \cdot 	ext{rtol} + V_{	ext{scale}} \cdot \epsilon_m \sqrt{N} +  rac{V_{	ext{scale}}}{N^{1.5}}ight) \] 7) Periodic Boundaries ¶ Description: Verifies matrix topology connectivity. Signals leaving the right boundary must wrap to the left boundary. Periodic in X direction with Neumann in Y. Domain: \(32 	imes 32\) grid, \(L = 0.001\) m Boundary Conditions: X-Axis: \(\phi(0, y) = \phi(L_x, y)\) (Periodic, PeriodicFlagX1 = 1 ) Y-Axis: \(\dfrac{\partial \phi}{\partial y} = 0\) (Neumann) Source: Neutral dipole — electron and positron clouds at symmetric x-positions. Metrics & Pass Criteria: Periodicity (Derivative Continuity): Checks that the first derivative of \(\phi\) is continuous across the periodic boundary (left–right wrap-around). Automatically detects whether the solver duplicates the endpoint ( \(\phi[0] = \phi[N_x]\) ) or not. Pass if: \[ 	ext{derivative jump} < K \cdot \!\left(	ext{max internal curvature} + V_{	ext{range}} \cdot 	ext{rtol} + V_{	ext{range}} \cdot \epsilon_m \sqrt{N}ight) \] 8) Analytical Accuracy (Green's Function) ¶ Description: Quantifies numerical error by comparing the grid solution to the analytical \(\ln(r)\) profile for a 2D point charge. Domain: \(64 	imes 64\) grid, \(L = 0.001\) m Boundary Conditions: All Dirichlet \(\phi = 0\) . Source: Electron charge cloud at center \((L_x/2,\, L_y/2)\) . Comparison: Fit \(\phi_{	ext{num}}(r)\) to \(A \ln(r) + B\) via linear regression in the annular region \(3\Delta x < r < 0.35 \min(L_x, L_y)\) . Metrics & Pass Criteria: Analytical Fit ( \(1 - R^2\) ): Coefficient of determination for \(\phi\) vs \(\ln(r)\) regression. Measures how well the numerical potential follows the expected logarithmic profile. Pass if: \[ 1 - R^2 < K \cdot \!\left((\Delta x / r_{\min})^2 + 100 \cdot \epsilon_might) \] III. Particle-Mesh Coupling Verification ¶ These tests verify the projection of particle quantities to the grid (Deposition) and the sampling of grid fields to the particle (Interpolation/Gathering). Threshold framework: All thresholds are adaptive, computed as \[ 	ext{threshold} = K 	imes (	ext{physics\_err} + 	ext{float\_err}) \] where \(K=10\) is a safety factor. Physics error captures solver residual ( \(O(	ext{rtol})\) ), discretization ( \(O(\Delta x^2)\) ), and CIC shape-function effects. Float error captures \(O(\epsilon_m \sqrt{N})\) accumulation ( \(\epsilon_m \approx 2.22 	imes 10^{-16}\) ). Grid charge is inferred via Gauss's law: \[ Q_{	ext{grid}} = -\epsilon_0 \sum_{	ext{interior}} (
abla^2 \phi)_{i,j}\, \Delta x \, \Delta y \] 9) Charge Deposition & Potential Topology ¶ Description: Verifies that deposited charge creates a quantitatively correct and symmetric potential well. Ensures coupling between CIC particle weighting and the Poisson solver, and that physical constants ( \(\epsilon_0\) ) are correctly applied. Domain: \(32 	imes 32\) grid, \(L = 0.001\) m, All-Dirichlet ( \(\phi = 0\) ). Source: Charge cloud at center \((L_x/2,\, L_y/2)\) . Total charge \(Q_{	ext{total}} = -q_e \cdot n \cdot \Delta x \cdot \Delta y\) where \(n = 2.1 	imes 10^{15}\) m \(^{-3}\) (from static_deposit.inp ). Simulation: 5 steps, \(\Delta t = 10^{-12}\) s. Field read from final iteration. Metrics & Pass Criteria: Integrated Charge Conservation: \[ \epsilon_Q = |Q_{	ext{grid}} - Q_{	ext{total}}| \] Pass if: \[ \epsilon_Q < K \cdot |Q_{	ext{total}}| \cdot \!\left(	ext{rtol} +  rac{1}{N} + \epsilon_m \sqrt{N_{	ext{cells}}}ight) \] (Combines solver residual, \(O(1/N)\) Laplacian discretization error, and float accumulation.) Symmetry: \[ \epsilon_{	ext{sym}} = P_{99.9}\! igl(|\phi(x,y) - \phi(L_x-x,\, L_y-y)| igr) \] over interior points (excluding 2-cell border and 3-cell radius around center singularity). Pass if: \[ \epsilon_{	ext{sym}} < K \cdot V_{	ext{scale}} \cdot \!\left(	ext{rtol} + \epsilon_m \sqrt{N_{	ext{pts}}} +  rac{1}{N_{	ext{grid}}}ight) \] (Combines solver residual, float accumulation, and \(O(1/N)\) grid discretization asymmetry from CIC and Laplacian.) L2 Profile Error: Relative RMS between simulated \(\phi\) and analytic Green's function \(\phi_{	ext{ana}}\) (2D Fourier series for point charge in grounded box, 50 modes). Pass if: \[ \sqrt{ rac{\sum (\phi - \phi_{	ext{ana}})^2}{\sum \phi_{	ext{ana}}^2}} < K \cdot \!\left(	ext{rtol} +  rac{1}{N_{	ext{grid}}} + \epsilon_m \sqrt{N_{	ext{pts}}}ight) \] (Combines solver residual, \(O(1/N)\) Fourier truncation and grid discretization error, and float accumulation.) 10) Field Interpolation (Acceleration) ¶ Description: Verifies that a particle in a uniform E-field experiences the correct Lorentz acceleration \(a = qE/m\) by measuring velocity change over multiple timesteps. Domain: \(32 	imes 32\) grid, \(L_y\) from input file (default \(L = 0.001\) m). Boundary Conditions: Y-Axis (Electrodes): \(\phi(x, 0) = -10\) V, \(\phi(x, L_y) = +10\) V (Dirichlet) X-Axis (Open): \(\dfrac{\partial \phi}{\partial x} = 0\) (Neumann / Dielectric) Particle: Single electron ( \(q = -e\) , \(m = m_e\) ) at center, \(v_0 = 0\) . Simulation: 20 steps, \(\Delta t = 10^{-12}\) s, output every step. Metrics & Pass Criteria: Acceleration Accuracy: Linear fit \(v_y(t) = a_{	ext{meas}} \cdot t + v_0\) gives measured acceleration. Expected: \(a_{	ext{expected}} = \dfrac{q\, E_y}{m}\) where \(E_y = -(V_{	ext{top}} - V_{	ext{bot}}) / L_y\) . Pass if: \[ |a_{	ext{meas}} - a_{	ext{expected}}| < K \cdot |a_{	ext{expected}}| \cdot \!\left(	ext{rtol} +  rac{1}{N_{	ext{grid}}} + \epsilon_m \sqrt{N_{	ext{pts}}}ight) \] (Combines solver residual, \(O(1/N)\) grid error from CIC and finite-difference E, and float accumulation in the linear fit.) 11) Self-Force Stability (Stationary Particle) ¶ Description: Integration test for the full PIC loop: Deposit \(ho\) → Solve Poisson → Interpolate \(\mathbf{E}\) → Push. A stationary particle at the center of a symmetric grounded box should feel near-zero net force; any displacement is parasitic (self-force). Domain: \(32 	imes 32\) grid, \(L = 0.001\) m, All-Dirichlet ( \(\phi = 0\) ). Particle: Single electron at rest ( \(v_0 = 0\) ) centered at \((L_x/2,\, L_y/2)\) . Simulation: 20 steps, \(\Delta t = 10^{-12}\) s, output every step. Metrics & Pass Criteria: Parasitic Displacement: \[ \Delta r = \sqrt{(x_{	ext{final}} - x_0)^2 + (y_{	ext{final}} - y_0)^2} \] Pass if: \[ \Delta r < K \cdot \!\left(N_{	ext{steps}} \cdot \Delta x + \epsilon_m \cdot \Delta x \cdot \sqrt{N_{	ext{steps}}}ight) \] (PIC codes exhibit parasitic motion from CIC shape asymmetry, field gradient noise, and pusher-solver coupling. Threshold is grid-based: displacement bounded by \(O(N \cdot \Delta x)\) over the simulation.) 12) Current Deposition (Charge Conservation) ¶ Description: Verifies that moving a particle and re-depositing charge conserves total charge on the grid. This ensures Gauss's law ( \(
abla \cdot \mathbf{E} = ho / \epsilon_0\) ) holds at every timestep, critical for Esirkepov-type current deposition schemes. Domain: \(32 	imes 32\) grid, \(L = 0.001\) m, All-Dirichlet ( \(\phi = 0\) ). Particle: Single electron with \(v_x = 10^4\) m/s (traverses \({\sim}\,0.2\) cells over 10 steps). Simulation: 10 steps, \(\Delta t = 10^{-12}\) s, output every step. Poisson solver active ( FieldSolverFlag = 1 ). Metrics & Pass Criteria: Charge Conservation (Gauss): \[ \Delta Q = |Q_{	ext{grid}}(t_{	ext{final}}) - Q_{	ext{grid}}(t_0)| \] where \(Q_{	ext{grid}}\) is computed via discrete Laplacian of \(\phi\) . Pass if: \[ \Delta Q < K \cdot |Q| \cdot \!\left(	ext{rtol} + \epsilon_m \sqrt{N_{	ext{cells}}} +  rac{1}{N}ight) \] (Combines solver residual at two iterations, float accumulation, and \(O(1/N)\) CIC spreading discretization error.) docs.text: These tests verify the Boris integrator and 3V vector logic. Maxwell solver and Deposition are disabled ( FieldSolverFlag = 0 ). Threshold framework: All thresholds are adaptive, computed as \[ \text{threshold} = K \times (\text{physics\_err} + \text{float\_err}) \] where \(K=10\) is a safety factor. Physics error captures Boris integrator \(O(\Delta t^2)\) phase drift, and float error captures \(O(\epsilon_m \sqrt{N})\) accumulation over \(N\) output steps ( \(\epsilon_m \approx 2.22 \times 10^{-16}\) ).
docs.title: I. Particle Pusher Verification

docs.text: Description: Verifies basic cyclotron rotation in the simulation plane (x, y) and charge sign handling using an electron–positron pair. Field E: Disabled Field B: \(B=(0,\,0,\,0.1)\) T Particles: Species 1 (e−): \(q=-e,\; m=m_e,\; v_0=(10^6,\; -8794,\; 0)\) m/s Species 2 (e+): \(q=+e,\; m=m_e,\; v_0=(10^6,\; +8794,\; 0)\) m/s (The non-zero \(v_y\) is the Boris half-step back correction: \(v_y \approx \mp v_\perp \omega_c \Delta t / 2\) .) Simulation Time: \(\Delta t = 10^{-12}\) s, \(T_{\text{total}}= 3 \times T_{\text{Larmor}}\) . Only the last 1/3 of output steps is analyzed (initial transient skipped). Metrics & Pass Criteria: Energy Conservation (Absolute): \[ \epsilon_E = \max|E_k(t)-E_k(0)|, \quad E_k = \tfrac{1}{2}m(v_x^2+v_y^2+v_z^2) \] Pass if: \(\epsilon_E < K \cdot \epsilon_m \cdot \sqrt{N}\) 4-Radius Separation: \[ \Delta_{\text{sep}} = \max_t \left|\mathbf{x}_{e^-}(t) - \mathbf{x}_{e^+}(t)\right| \] Expected \(4 R_L\) where \(R_L = \dfrac{m\, v_\perp}{|q|\, B_0}\) . Pass if: \[ |\Delta_{\text{sep}} - 4 R_L| < K \cdot \!\left(4 R_L \cdot \frac{20(\omega_c \Delta t)^2}{12} + 4 R_L \cdot \epsilon_m \sqrt{N}\right) \] Y-Projection Trajectory: \[ \text{Extent} = \bigl(\max(y) - \min(y)\bigr) \cdot \Delta y \] Expected \(2 R_L\) . Pass if: \[ |\text{extent} - 2 R_L| < K \cdot \!\left(2 R_L \cdot \frac{10(\omega_c \Delta t)^2}{12} + 2 R_L \cdot \epsilon_m \sqrt{N}\right) \] Z-Axis Stability: \[ \Delta z = \max|z(t)-z(0)| \] Pass if: \(\Delta z < K \cdot R_L \cdot \epsilon_m \cdot \sqrt{N}\)
docs.title: 1) Multi-Species Larmor Orbit (In-Plane)

docs.text: Description: Verifies the coupling between the spatial grid (x) and the virtual velocity component ( \(v_z\) ) using a \(B_y\) field. Only the electron trajectory is analyzed. Field E: Disabled Field B: \(B=(0,\,0.1,\,0)\) T Particles: Species 1 (e−) & Species 2 (e+): \(v_0=(0,\;0,\;10^6)\) m/s Simulation Time: \(\Delta t = 10^{-12}\) s, \(T_{\text{total}}= 3 \times T_{\text{Larmor}}\) . Only the last 1/3 of output steps is analyzed. Metrics & Pass Criteria: Energy Conservation (Absolute): \[ \epsilon_E = \max|E_k(t)-E_k(0)| \] Pass if: \(\epsilon_E < K \cdot \epsilon_m \cdot \sqrt{N}\) X-Projection Trajectory: \[ \text{Extent} = \bigl(\max(x) - \min(x)\bigr) \cdot \Delta x \] Expected \(2 R_L\) . Pass if: \[ |\text{extent} - 2 R_L| < K \cdot \!\left(2 R_L \cdot \frac{10(\omega_c \Delta t)^2}{12} + 2 R_L \cdot \epsilon_m \sqrt{N}\right) \] Y-Axis Stability: \[ \Delta y = \max|y(t)-y(0)| \] Pass if: \(\Delta y < K \cdot R_L \cdot \epsilon_m \cdot \sqrt{N}\)
docs.title: 2) Multi-Species Larmor Orbit (Out-of-Plane / 3V)

docs.text: Description: Verifies the Lorentz force combination by creating a drift along the Y-axis via crossed E and B fields. Field E: From boundary potentials: \(V=0\) at \(x=0\) , \(V=100\) V at \(x=L_x=0.01\) m. Gives \(E_x = -10^4\) V/m. Field B: \(B=(0,\,0,\,0.1)\) T Particles: Species 1 (e−): \(v_0=(0,\; 10^5,\; 0)\) m/s. Placed at domain center. Simulation Time: \(\Delta t = 10^{-11}\) s, 400 steps, output every 20 steps. Metrics & Pass Criteria: Hamiltonian Conservation: \[ H = \tfrac{1}{2}m|\mathbf{v}|^2 + q\phi \] where \(\phi = -E_x \cdot x\) . Pass if: \[ \max|H(t) - H(0)| < K \cdot \!\left(|H_0| \cdot \frac{(\omega_c \Delta t)^2}{8} + |H_0| \cdot \epsilon_m \sqrt{N}\right) \] Drift Velocity (Y): Mean \(v_y\) over the second half of the simulation, expected \(v_{\text{drift}} = -E_x / B_z\) . Pass if: \[ |\bar{v}_y - v_{\text{drift}}| < K \cdot \!\left(|v_{\text{drift}}| \cdot \frac{(\omega_c \Delta t)^2}{8} + |v_{\text{drift}}| \cdot \epsilon_m \sqrt{N}\right) \]
docs.title: 3) E×B Drift

docs.text: These tests verify the Poisson solver logic \[ \nabla^2\phi = -\frac{\rho}{\epsilon_0} \] and boundary condition implementation. The solver uses an iterative method with target relative residual \(\text{rtol} \sim 10^{-6}\) . Threshold framework: Thresholds combine solver residual error ( \(O(\text{rtol})\) ), floating point accumulation ( \(O(\epsilon_m \sqrt{N_{\text{cells}}})\) ), and grid truncation error ( \(O(1/N)\) ), scaled by safety factor \(K=10\) .
docs.title: II. Field Solver Verification

docs.text: Description: Verifies the transition between fixed potential (electrodes) and open space (dielectric). Simulates a finite parallel-plate capacitor. Domain: \(32 \times 32\) grid, \(L = 0.001\) m Boundary Conditions: Y-Axis (Electrodes): \(\phi(x, 0) = -10\) V, \(\phi(x, L_y) = +10\) V (Dirichlet) X-Axis (Open): \(\dfrac{\partial \phi}{\partial x} = 0\) at \(x=0,\, x=L_x\) (Neumann / Dielectric) Source: No particles (vacuum solve) Metrics & Pass Criteria: Boundary Value Integrity: \[ \epsilon_{\text{BC}} = \max\!\bigl(|\phi_{y=0} - (-10)|,\; |\phi_{y=L_y} - 10|\bigr) \] Pass if: \(\epsilon_{\text{BC}} < K \cdot \epsilon_m \cdot V_0\) Field Uniformity (Interior): Standard deviation of \(E_y\) in the interior (excluding 2-cell border near Neumann/Dirichlet corners). Pass if: \[ \sigma(E_y) < K \cdot \!\left(|\bar{E}_y| \cdot \text{rtol} + |\bar{E}_y| \cdot \epsilon_m \sqrt{N_{\text{cells}}}\right) \]
docs.title: 4) Mixed Boundaries (Capacitor / Dirichlet-Neumann)

docs.text: Description: Verifies solver stability for a floating potential system using all-Neumann boundaries. Uses a neutral dipole to ensure \(\int \rho \, dV = 0\) . Domain: \(32 \times 32\) grid, \(L = 0.001\) m Boundary Conditions: All boundaries: \(\dfrac{\partial \phi}{\partial n} = 0\) (Neumann everywhere) Source: Neutral Dipole — electron cloud at \(x \approx 0.35\, L\) , positron cloud at \(x \approx 0.65\, L\) . Metrics & Pass Criteria: Boundary Flux Leakage: Maximum of mean \(|E_n|\) across all four boundaries. Pass if: \[ \max\!\bigl(\overline{|E_x|}_{\text{walls}},\; \overline{|E_y|}_{\text{walls}}\bigr) < K \cdot \!\left(E_{\text{scale}} \cdot \text{rtol} + E_{\text{scale}} \cdot \epsilon_m \sqrt{N} + \frac{E_{\text{scale}}}{N_{\min}}\right) \] where \(E_{\text{scale}} = \max|\mathbf{E}|\) over the domain, \(N_{\min} = \min(N_x, N_y)\) .
docs.title: 5) Fully Open Boundaries (Isolated System)

docs.text: Description: Verifies the basic "grounded box" scenario. Tests solver matrix construction and solution symmetry. Domain: \(32 \times 32\) grid, \(L = 0.001\) m Boundary Conditions: All boundaries: \(\phi = 0\) (Ground) Source: Electron charge cloud centered at \((L_x/2,\, L_y/2)\) . Metrics & Pass Criteria: Boundary Zero Check: \[ \epsilon_{\text{wall}} = \max_{\text{all boundaries}} |\phi| \] Pass if: \(\epsilon_{\text{wall}} < K \cdot \epsilon_m \cdot \max(|\phi_{\text{boundary}}|, 1)\) Symmetry: \[ \epsilon_{\text{sym}} = P_{99.9}\!\bigl(|\phi(x,y) - \phi(L_x-x,\, L_y-y)|\bigr) \] over interior points (excluding 2-cell border and 3-cell radius around center singularity). Pass if: \[ \epsilon_{\text{sym}} < K \cdot \!\left(V_{\text{scale}} \cdot \text{rtol} + V_{\text{scale}} \cdot \epsilon_m \sqrt{N} + \frac{V_{\text{scale}}}{N^{1.5}}\right) \]
docs.title: 6) Closed Metal Box (All-Dirichlet)

docs.text: Description: Verifies matrix topology connectivity. Signals leaving the right boundary must wrap to the left boundary. Periodic in X direction with Neumann in Y. Domain: \(32 \times 32\) grid, \(L = 0.001\) m Boundary Conditions: X-Axis: \(\phi(0, y) = \phi(L_x, y)\) (Periodic, PeriodicFlagX1 = 1 ) Y-Axis: \(\dfrac{\partial \phi}{\partial y} = 0\) (Neumann) Source: Neutral dipole — electron and positron clouds at symmetric x-positions. Metrics & Pass Criteria: Periodicity (Derivative Continuity): Checks that the first derivative of \(\phi\) is continuous across the periodic boundary (left–right wrap-around). Automatically detects whether the solver duplicates the endpoint ( \(\phi[0] = \phi[N_x]\) ) or not. Pass if: \[ \text{derivative jump} < K \cdot \!\left(\text{max internal curvature} + V_{\text{range}} \cdot \text{rtol} + V_{\text{range}} \cdot \epsilon_m \sqrt{N}\right) \]
docs.title: 7) Periodic Boundaries

docs.text: Description: Quantifies numerical error by comparing the grid solution to the analytical \(\ln(r)\) profile for a 2D point charge. Domain: \(64 \times 64\) grid, \(L = 0.001\) m Boundary Conditions: All Dirichlet \(\phi = 0\) . Source: Electron charge cloud at center \((L_x/2,\, L_y/2)\) . Comparison: Fit \(\phi_{\text{num}}(r)\) to \(A \ln(r) + B\) via linear regression in the annular region \(3\Delta x < r < 0.35 \min(L_x, L_y)\) . Metrics & Pass Criteria: Analytical Fit ( \(1 - R^2\) ): Coefficient of determination for \(\phi\) vs \(\ln(r)\) regression. Measures how well the numerical potential follows the expected logarithmic profile. Pass if: \[ 1 - R^2 < K \cdot \!\left((\Delta x / r_{\min})^2 + 100 \cdot \epsilon_m\right) \]
docs.title: 8) Analytical Accuracy (Green's Function)

docs.text: These tests verify the projection of particle quantities to the grid (Deposition) and the sampling of grid fields to the particle (Interpolation/Gathering). Threshold framework: All thresholds are adaptive, computed as \[ \text{threshold} = K \times (\text{physics\_err} + \text{float\_err}) \] where \(K=10\) is a safety factor. Physics error captures solver residual ( \(O(\text{rtol})\) ), discretization ( \(O(\Delta x^2)\) ), and CIC shape-function effects. Float error captures \(O(\epsilon_m \sqrt{N})\) accumulation ( \(\epsilon_m \approx 2.22 \times 10^{-16}\) ). Grid charge is inferred via Gauss's law: \[ Q_{\text{grid}} = -\epsilon_0 \sum_{\text{interior}} (\nabla^2 \phi)_{i,j}\, \Delta x \, \Delta y \]
docs.title: III. Particle-Mesh Coupling Verification

docs.text: Description: Verifies that deposited charge creates a quantitatively correct and symmetric potential well. Ensures coupling between CIC particle weighting and the Poisson solver, and that physical constants ( \(\epsilon_0\) ) are correctly applied. Domain: \(32 \times 32\) grid, \(L = 0.001\) m, All-Dirichlet ( \(\phi = 0\) ). Source: Charge cloud at center \((L_x/2,\, L_y/2)\) . Total charge \(Q_{\text{total}} = -q_e \cdot n \cdot \Delta x \cdot \Delta y\) where \(n = 2.1 \times 10^{15}\) m \(^{-3}\) (from static_deposit.inp ). Simulation: 5 steps, \(\Delta t = 10^{-12}\) s. Field read from final iteration. Metrics & Pass Criteria: Integrated Charge Conservation: \[ \epsilon_Q = |Q_{\text{grid}} - Q_{\text{total}}| \] Pass if: \[ \epsilon_Q < K \cdot |Q_{\text{total}}| \cdot \!\left(\text{rtol} + \frac{1}{N} + \epsilon_m \sqrt{N_{\text{cells}}}\right) \] (Combines solver residual, \(O(1/N)\) Laplacian discretization error, and float accumulation.) Symmetry: \[ \epsilon_{\text{sym}} = P_{99.9}\!\bigl(|\phi(x,y) - \phi(L_x-x,\, L_y-y)|\bigr) \] over interior points (excluding 2-cell border and 3-cell radius around center singularity). Pass if: \[ \epsilon_{\text{sym}} < K \cdot V_{\text{scale}} \cdot \!\left(\text{rtol} + \epsilon_m \sqrt{N_{\text{pts}}} + \frac{1}{N_{\text{grid}}}\right) \] (Combines solver residual, float accumulation, and \(O(1/N)\) grid discretization asymmetry from CIC and Laplacian.) L2 Profile Error: Relative RMS between simulated \(\phi\) and analytic Green's function \(\phi_{\text{ana}}\) (2D Fourier series for point charge in grounded box, 50 modes). Pass if: \[ \sqrt{\frac{\sum (\phi - \phi_{\text{ana}})^2}{\sum \phi_{\text{ana}}^2}} < K \cdot \!\left(\text{rtol} + \frac{1}{N_{\text{grid}}} + \epsilon_m \sqrt{N_{\text{pts}}}\right) \] (Combines solver residual, \(O(1/N)\) Fourier truncation and grid discretization error, and float accumulation.)
docs.title: 9) Charge Deposition & Potential Topology

docs.text: Description: Verifies that a particle in a uniform E-field experiences the correct Lorentz acceleration \(a = qE/m\) by measuring velocity change over multiple timesteps. Domain: \(32 \times 32\) grid, \(L_y\) from input file (default \(L = 0.001\) m). Boundary Conditions: Y-Axis (Electrodes): \(\phi(x, 0) = -10\) V, \(\phi(x, L_y) = +10\) V (Dirichlet) X-Axis (Open): \(\dfrac{\partial \phi}{\partial x} = 0\) (Neumann / Dielectric) Particle: Single electron ( \(q = -e\) , \(m = m_e\) ) at center, \(v_0 = 0\) . Simulation: 20 steps, \(\Delta t = 10^{-12}\) s, output every step. Metrics & Pass Criteria: Acceleration Accuracy: Linear fit \(v_y(t) = a_{\text{meas}} \cdot t + v_0\) gives measured acceleration. Expected: \(a_{\text{expected}} = \dfrac{q\, E_y}{m}\) where \(E_y = -(V_{\text{top}} - V_{\text{bot}}) / L_y\) . Pass if: \[ |a_{\text{meas}} - a_{\text{expected}}| < K \cdot |a_{\text{expected}}| \cdot \!\left(\text{rtol} + \frac{1}{N_{\text{grid}}} + \epsilon_m \sqrt{N_{\text{pts}}}\right) \] (Combines solver residual, \(O(1/N)\) grid error from CIC and finite-difference E, and float accumulation in the linear fit.)
docs.title: 10) Field Interpolation (Acceleration)

docs.text: Description: Integration test for the full PIC loop: Deposit \(\rho\) → Solve Poisson → Interpolate \(\mathbf{E}\) → Push. A stationary particle at the center of a symmetric grounded box should feel near-zero net force; any displacement is parasitic (self-force). Domain: \(32 \times 32\) grid, \(L = 0.001\) m, All-Dirichlet ( \(\phi = 0\) ). Particle: Single electron at rest ( \(v_0 = 0\) ) centered at \((L_x/2,\, L_y/2)\) . Simulation: 20 steps, \(\Delta t = 10^{-12}\) s, output every step. Metrics & Pass Criteria: Parasitic Displacement: \[ \Delta r = \sqrt{(x_{\text{final}} - x_0)^2 + (y_{\text{final}} - y_0)^2} \] Pass if: \[ \Delta r < K \cdot \!\left(N_{\text{steps}} \cdot \Delta x + \epsilon_m \cdot \Delta x \cdot \sqrt{N_{\text{steps}}}\right) \] (PIC codes exhibit parasitic motion from CIC shape asymmetry, field gradient noise, and pusher-solver coupling. Threshold is grid-based: displacement bounded by \(O(N \cdot \Delta x)\) over the simulation.)
docs.title: 11) Self-Force Stability (Stationary Particle)

docs.text: Description: Verifies that moving a particle and re-depositing charge conserves total charge on the grid. This ensures Gauss's law ( \(\nabla \cdot \mathbf{E} = \rho / \epsilon_0\) ) holds at every timestep, critical for Esirkepov-type current deposition schemes. Domain: \(32 \times 32\) grid, \(L = 0.001\) m, All-Dirichlet ( \(\phi = 0\) ). Particle: Single electron with \(v_x = 10^4\) m/s (traverses \({\sim}\,0.2\) cells over 10 steps). Simulation: 10 steps, \(\Delta t = 10^{-12}\) s, output every step. Poisson solver active ( FieldSolverFlag = 1 ). Metrics & Pass Criteria: Charge Conservation (Gauss): \[ \Delta Q = |Q_{\text{grid}}(t_{\text{final}}) - Q_{\text{grid}}(t_0)| \] where \(Q_{\text{grid}}\) is computed via discrete Laplacian of \(\phi\) . Pass if: \[ \Delta Q < K \cdot |Q| \cdot \!\left(\text{rtol} + \epsilon_m \sqrt{N_{\text{cells}}} + \frac{1}{N}\right) \] (Combines solver residual at two iterations, float accumulation, and \(O(1/N)\) CIC spreading discretization error.)
docs.title: 12) Current Deposition (Charge Conservation)
